definition: adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack
ministry/department/section/part/division/troops/board/classifier for works of literature, films, machines etc

sentences.english: The armed forces are so under-financed that aircraft crashes have become a monthly occurrence.
sentences.chinese: 武裝部隊資金嚴重不足，墜機事件已經每月出現一起。

sentences.english: They were released after SSB officials raised the issue with Nepal's Armed Police Force.
sentences.chinese: 印方官員在向尼泊爾武裝部隊交涉後他們得以獲釋。

sentences.english: He outlines it in the Armed Forces Journal.
sentences.chinese: 他在《武裝部隊雜誌》描出了大綱。

sentences.english: The King commands the armed forces.
The armed forces have launched offensives to recapture lost ground .
sentences.chinese: 這支武裝部隊已發動進攻要奪回失去的陣地。

sentences.english: As an individual, a member of the armed forces may never voluntarily surrender.
sentences.chinese: 作爲個人，武裝部隊的一員將永遠不能志願投降。

sentences.english: Sichuan Province armed police officers work yesterday to dismantle endangered houses in Panzhihua City.
sentences.chinese: 昨天，四川省武裝部隊官兵在攀枝花市拆除該市危房。

sentences.english: The President commands the armed forces.
He exacted an oath of loyalty to himself throughout the armed forces, from foot soldier to general.
sentences.chinese: 他強迫武裝部隊的全體官兵宣誓效忠於他本人。

sentences.english: The armed forces deliberately integrated their units .
sentences.chinese: 武裝部隊有意地混編了他們的隊伍。

pinyin: Wu1 zi1 bie2 ke4 si1 tan3
